title: DDI assessment
text: May-2024, ICH published new harmonized guidance assessment enzyme- transporter-mediated drug interactions adopted ICH-abiding regulatory agencies, including FDA, EMA PMDA. Currently (Nov-2024), following guidance documents provided individual regulatory authorities: M12 Drug Interaction Studies (FDA, Aug-2024) M12 Questions Answers document (Aug-2024) ICH M12 Drug Interaction Studies (EMA, May-2024)

title: DDI assessment
text: general concept, risk enzyme transporter interactions evaluated given drug exposure level corresponds maximal unbound clinical exposure relevant pharmacokinetic compartment. interactions hepatic enzymes, unbound maximal plasma concentration steady state (\(I_{max,ss,u}\)) considered, intestinal enzymes victim orally administered drugs, maximal clinical dose, dissolved volume 250 mg (\(I_{gut}\)). interactions basolateral hepatic transporters (OATP1B1, OATP1B3), unbound hepatic inlet concentration (\(I_{max,inlet,u}\)) considered composed \(I_{max,ss,u}\) portal venous term reflecting intestinally absorbed drug escaping gut metabolism. concentrations can automatically derived following set drug-specific parameters: specification key compound parameters therefore first step formal analysis. scope package, key parameters aggregated ‘perpetrator’ object. package contains sample perpetrator object ficitional drug ‘examplinib’: ddir package provides multiple options create perpetrator objects. simplest case, function make_perpetrator() can used: options presented dedicated vignette (see vignette("load-data")). facilitate generation R notebook-based reports, property_table() can used print markdown-formatted table key compound parameters: Compound parameters examplinib
code: examplinib_parent #> ----- DDI perpetrator object ----- #> name         examplinib                    #> oral         TRUE                          #> mw           492.6                         #> dose         450          clinical dose    #> imaxss       3530         study 001        #> fu           0.023        study 002        #> fumic        1            default          #> rb           1            study 003        #> fa           0.81         study 003        #> fg           1            default          #> ka           0.00267      unknown          #> solubility   Inf          default perp <- make_perpetrator(   name = "test",   dose = 100,   imaxss = 1000,   mw = 500,   oral = TRUE,   fu = 1,   fumic = 1,   rb = 1,   fa = 1,   fg = 1,   ka = 0.1,   solubility = Inf ) property_table(examplinib_parent)

title: DDI assessment
text: relevant perpetrator concentrations (\(\mu M\)) perpetrator compound can determined using key_concentrations() - please see documentation function details calculations. function returns named numeric vector naked concentrations, markdown-formatted tabular output can directly embedded R notebook documents can generated using `conc_table()’: Key perpetrator concentrations examplinib
code: key_concentrations(examplinib_parent) #>         igut      imaxssu   imaxinletu   imaxintest  #> 3654.0803898    0.1648193    0.1929384    6.5855664  conc_table(examplinib_parent)

title: Load compound-specific data
text: functions within ddir package evaluate various DDI risks expect first argument perpetrator object contains compound properties needed calculate relevant perpetrator concentrations. following parameters required create perpetrator object:

title: Load compound-specific data
text: basic option, compound property data can hard-coded R script data frame converted perpetrator object: Note constructor function perpetrator objects expects values character type. code, strictly required fields provided, fields automatically set respective default values construction perpetrator compound.
code: parent_data_frame <- data.frame(   param = c("name", "oral", "mw", "dose", "imaxss"),   value = c("examplinib", "TRUE", "492.6", "450", "3530"),   source = c("", "", "", "", "") )  parent <- new_perpetrator(parent_data_frame) parent #> ----- DDI perpetrator object ----- #> name         examplinib              #> oral         TRUE                    #> mw           492.6                   #> dose         450                     #> imaxss       3530                    #> fu           1            default    #> fumic        1            default    #> rb           1            default    #> fa           1            default    #> fg           1            default    #> ka           0.1          default    #> solubility   Inf          default

title: Load compound-specific data
text: tibble package part tidyverse meta-package provides convenient function, tribble(), construct data frames row-wise fashion. renders code much readable:
code: parent_tribble <- tribble(   ~param,   ~value,       ~source,   "name",   "examplinib", "",   "oral",   "TRUE",       "",   "mw",     "492.6",     "",   "dose",   "450",        "",   "imaxss", "3530",       ""  ) parent <- new_perpetrator(parent_tribble) parent #> ----- DDI perpetrator object ----- #> name         examplinib              #> oral         TRUE                    #> mw           492.6                   #> dose         450                     #> imaxss       3530                    #> fu           1            default    #> fumic        1            default    #> rb           1            default    #> fa           1            default    #> fg           1            default    #> ka           0.1          default    #> solubility   Inf          default

title: Load compound-specific data
text: Alternatively, data can also provided comma-separated values (csv) external data file, read using read_perpetrators(). csv file ‘examplinib_compounds_single.csv’ included part package demonstration purposes: code, fs::path_package("extdata/examplinib_compounds_single.csv", package = "ddir") construct needed resolve path sample file within package structure. regular use, file name provided . csv file expected ‘long table’ format: line must start compound name, followed parameter name, value (optionally) source information. content typical compound file may look like: fields within line must separated commas. lines starting ‘#’ considered comments evaluated.
code: parent_perpetrator <- read_perpetrators(   fs::path_package("extdata/examplinib_compounds_single.csv", package = "ddir") ) parent_perpetrator %>%   class() #> [1] "perpetrator" "data.frame" # PARENT     # compound,  param,    value,     source     examplinib,  oral,     TRUE,     examplinib,  mw,       492.6,     examplinib,  dose,     450,       clinical dose     examplinib,  imaxss,   3530,      study 001     examplinib,  fu,       0.023,     study 002     examplinib,  fumic,    1,         default     examplinib,  rb,       1,         study 003     examplinib,  fa,       0.81,      study 003     examplinib,  fg,       1,         default     examplinib,  ka,       0.00267,   unknown

title: Load compound-specific data
text: DDI risk calculations done within R notebook, highly recommend keep data, code report text single Rmd document can knitted human-readable report, compound-specific data can conveniently provided form data chunks. neat feature introduced knitrdata package. text contained chunks type ‘data’ assigned -character variable name defined ‘output.var’ chunk header document rendered: Similar csv file example, content variable can read perpetrator object: Note since data read file, input string variable wrapped textConnection() construct. Also note data file contains data two different compounds, ‘examplinib’ ‘M1’. output read_perpetrators() function therefore list perpetrator objects case. find sample DDI report fictional drug ‘examplinib’ provided part ddir package uses approach. DDI assessment, feel free copy Rmd file merely replace compound-specific data obtain basic DDI report drug.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: function evaluates clinical risk direct (reversible) CYP inhibition according basic model defined relevant regulatory guideline.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
code: basic_cyp_inhibition_risk(perp, cyp_inh)

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibition data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'ki' \(K_i\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'source' Optional source information character.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: data frame.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: basic modeling direct (reversible) CYP enzyme inhibition, ratio relevant inhibitor concentration \(K_i\) respective CYP enzyme considered, .e., \(R\) hepatic enzymes \(R_{gut}\) intestinal enzymes (refer Section 2.1.2.1 ICH M12 guidance document).

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: $$R=\frac{C_{max,ss,u}}{K_{,u}}$$ \(R\) values > 0.02, .e., maximal unbound perpetrator concentrations 50-fold \(K_i\) considered indicate potential clinical CYP inhibition risk using method.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: $$R_{gut}=\frac{I_{gut}}{K_{,u}}$$ $$I_{gut}=\frac{Dose}{250\ mg}$$ \(R\) values > 10 considered indicate clinical risk intestinal CYP3A inhibition. output, columns risk_hep risk_intest indicate whether regulatory threshold reached respective enzyme.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_tdi CYP TDI data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' perpetrator compound name character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme character. 'ki' \(K_I\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'kinact' \(k_{inact}\) 1/h numeric. 'source' Optional source information character, cyp_kdeg CYP turnover data data frame. Defaults built-reference data, cyp_turnover.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
text: data frame.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
text: risk assessment based : $$R=\frac {k_{obs} + k_{deg}}{k_{deg}}$$ $$k_{obs}=\frac {5*k_{inact}*C_{max,u}}{K_{,u} + 5 * C_{max,u}}$$ Values \(R > 1.25\) suggest relevant TDI potential. CYP degradation rates, \(k_{deg}\) physiological constants derived scientific literature. package provides standard values \(k_{deg}\) cyp_turnover commonly used. present version, risk hepatic TDI CYP enzymes calculated.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
code: basic_cyp_tdi_risk(examplinib_parent, examplinib_cyp_tdi_data) #>      cyp   ki    fu kinact   kdeg    source        r risk #> 1 CYP3A4 0.17 0.023   0.04 0.0193 study 001 3.062752 TRUE

title: Overall DDI risk summary text block — ddi_risk_summary
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibition data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'ki' \(K_i\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'source' Optional source information character. cyp_tdi CYP TDI data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' perpetrator compound name character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme character. 'ki' \(K_I\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'kinact' \(k_{inact}\) 1/h numeric. 'source' Optional source information character, cyp_ind CYP induction data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'emax' \(E_{max}\), .e., maximum induction effect determined vitro numeric. 'ec50' \(EC_{50}\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'maxc' maximal concentration \(\mu M\) tested vitro assay numeric. 'source' Optional source information character. ugt_inh UGT inhibition data data frame, following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound. 'ugt' UGT enzyme (upper case) character. 'ic50' \(IC_{50}\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'source' Optional source information character. transporter_inh Transporter inhibition data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' perpetrator compound name. 'cyp' UGT enzyme (upper case) character. 'ic50' \(IC_{50}\) inhibition μM. 'source' Optional source information character. d Scaling factor, defaults 1. include_induction Switch define whether induction effects included calculation (C-terms per FDA guideline) substr CYP probe substrates used data frame, defaults cyp_reference_substrates. data frame expected following fields: 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'substrate' substrate name character. 'fgut' fraction drug escaping gut metabolism. 'fm' fraction drug undergoes hepatic metabolism. 'fmcyp' fraction metabolized respective CYP enzyme. cyp_kdeg CYP turnover data data frame. Defaults built-reference data, cyp_turnover.

title: Overall DDI risk summary text block — ddi_risk_summary
text: Markdown-formatted text output.

title: Overall DDI risk summary text block — ddi_risk_summary
code:
ddi_risk_summary(examplinib_compounds, examplinib_cyp_inhibition_data,   examplinib_cyp_tdi_data, examplinib_cyp_induction_data,   examplinib_ugt_inhibition_data, examplinib_transporter_inhibition_data) #> [1] "* examplinib has a clinical risk for direct inhibition of CYP2C9 and CYP2C19 (basic modeling)
* examplinib has a clinical risk for time-dependent inhibition of CYP3A4
* examplinib has a clinical risk for induction of CYP3A4 (fold-change method)
* examplinib has a clinical risk for induction of CYP3A4 (basic kinetic method)
* M1 has a clinical risk for induction of CYP2B6 and CYP3A4 (fold-change method)
* M1 has a clinical risk for induction of CYP2B6 and CYP3A4 (basic kinetic method)
* based on mechanistic-static modeling (S-warfarin and omeprazole), examplinib has a clinical risk for inhibition of CYP2C9 and CYP2C19
* based on mechanistic-static modeling (midazolam), examplinib has a clinical risk for induction of CYP3A4
* examplinib has a clinical risk for inhibition of UGT1A1, UGT1A3, UGT1A4, UGT1A6, UGT1A9, UGT2B7, UGT2B15 and UGT2B17
* M1 has a clinical risk for inhibition of UGT1A1 and UGT2B17
* examplinib has a clinical risk for inhibition of P-gp (intestinal), P-gp (hepatic), BCRP (intestinal), BCRP (hepatic), MATE1 and MATE2k" ddi_risk_summary(examplinib_parent, examplinib_cyp_inhibition_data) #> [1] "* examplinib has a clinical risk for direct inhibition of CYP2C9 and CYP2C19 (basic modeling)
* based on mechanistic-static modeling (S-warfarin and omeprazole), examplinib has a clinical risk for inhibition of CYP2C9 and CYP2C19"

text: $$I_{gut} = \frac{D} {250}$$ exceeds aqueous solubility drug, \(I_{gut}\) set solubility.

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: $$I_{max,ss,u}=I_{max,ss} * f_u$$

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: orally administered (parent) compounds, hepatic inlet concentration systemic concentration plus portal term: $$portal\ term = D*\frac{F_a*F_g*k_a}{Q_h*R_B}*1000\ ng/ml$$ \(D\) administered dose mg, \(F_a\) fraction absorbed oral administration, \(F_g\) fraction available gut metabolism, \(k_a\) absorption rate, \(Q_h\) hepatic blood flow \(R_B\) blood--plasma ratio. relevant hepatic inlet concentration (\(I_{max,inlet,u}\), also called \(I_h\) mechanistic static modeling equations) concentration sum maximal systemic plasma concentration portal contribution: $$I_{max,inlet,u}=(I_{max,ss} + portal\ term) * f_u$$

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: orally administered (parent) compounds, villous concentration gut (\(I_{enteric}\), also called \(I_g\) mechanistic static modeling equations) calculated : $$I_{enteric,u} = D * \frac{F_a*k_a}{Q_{ent}} *1000\ ng/ml$$ \(F_a\) fraction absorbed oral administration, \(k_a\) absorption rate, \(Q_{ent}\) enteric villous blood flow \(R_B\) blood--plasma distribution ratio compound. title: Basic kinetic CYP induction risk — kinetic_cyp_induction_risk
text: Basic kinetic modeling CYP induction risk considers: $$R = \frac {1}{1 + d * \frac {E_{max}*10*C_{max,ss,u}}{EC_{50,u} + 10 * C_{max,ss,u}}}$$ \(d\) scaling factor standard value 1. different value can used warranted prior experience experimental conditions. \(R \le 0.8\) suggest relevant vivo CYP induction potential.

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibition data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'ki' \(K_i\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'source' Optional source information character. cyp_ind CYP induction data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'emax' \(E_{max}\), .e., maximum induction effect determined vitro numeric. 'ec50' \(EC_{50}\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'maxc' maximal concentration \(\mu M\) tested vitro assay numeric. 'source' Optional source information character. cyp_tdi CYP TDI data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' perpetrator compound name character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme character. 'ki' \(K_I\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'kinact' \(k_{inact}\) 1/h numeric. 'source' Optional source information character, d Scaling factor, defaults 1. include_induction Switch define whether induction effects included calculation (C-terms per FDA guideline) substr CYP probe substrates used data frame, defaults cyp_reference_substrates. data frame expected following fields: 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'substrate' substrate name character. 'fgut' fraction drug escaping gut metabolism. 'fm' fraction drug undergoes hepatic metabolism. 'fmcyp' fraction metabolized respective CYP enzyme. cyp_kdeg CYP turnover data data frame. Defaults built-reference data, cyp_turnover.

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: data frame.

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: approach, AUC ratios CYP-specific probe substrates calculated based known intestinal hepatic metabolism. Direct (competitive) time-dependent inhibition terms, well enzyme induction terms considered. details, refer section 7.5.1.2 ICH M12 guideline. $$AUCR = \frac{1}{A_g*B_g*C_g* \left(1-F_g \right)+F_g} * \frac{1}{A_h*B_h*C_h*f_m+\left(1-f_m\right)}$$ individual terms :

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: $$A_g = \frac{1}{1+\frac{I_g}{K_i}}$$ $$A_h = \frac{1}{1+\frac{I_h}{K_i}}$$

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: $$B_g = \frac{k_{deg,g}}{k_{deg,g} + \frac{I_g*k_{inact}}{I_g+K_I}}$$ $$B_h = \frac{k_{deg,h}}{k_{deg,h} + \frac{I_h*k_{inact}}{I_h+K_I}}$$

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: $$C_g = 1 + \frac{d*E_{max}*I_g}{I_g+EC_{50}}$$ $$C_h = 1 + \frac{d*E_{max}*I_h}{I_h+EC_{50}}$$ hepatic inlet concentration \(I_h=I_{max,inlet,u}\) intestinal concentration \(I_g=I_{enteric,u}\), see key_concentrations(). \(d\) scaling factor CYP induction term standard value 1. different value can used warranted prior experience experimental setup.

title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
text: perpetrator object one compound input source, list perpetrator objects.

title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
text: following fields expected input (order): 'name' compound name character. 'parameter' parameter character. 'value' respective value character. 'source' Optional source information character. following parameters expected: 'oral' Boolean (.e., TRUE FALSE) indicate whether drug subject first-pass effects. 'mw' molar weight g/mol numeric. 'dose' clinically administered dose mg numeric. 'imaxss' (total) \(C_{max}\) ng/ml administration clinical dose. 'fu' free unbound) fraction drug plasma. 'fumic' free (unbound) fraction microsomal preparations. 'rb' blood--plasma concentration ratio. 'fa' fraction absorbed drug. 'fg' fraction administered dose escaping gut metabolism. 'ka' absorption rate constant 1/min. 'solubility' aqueous solubility compound mg/l. Lines starting '#' considered comments evaluated. Note multiple compounds, e.g., parent metabolites may included perpetrator file. example valid compound file:
code: # PARENT     # compound,  param,    value,     source     examplinib,  oral,     TRUE,     examplinib,  mw,       492.6,     examplinib,  dose,     450,       clinical dose     examplinib,  imaxss,   3530,      study 001     examplinib,  fu,       0.023,     study 002     examplinib,  fumic,    1,         default     examplinib,  rb,       1,         study 003     examplinib,  fa,       0.81,      study 003     examplinib,  fg,       1,         default     examplinib,  ka,       0.00267,   unknown      # METABOLITE     # compound,  param,    value,     source     M1,          oral,     FALSE,     M1,          mw,       506.56,     M1,          dose,     NA,     M1,          imaxss,   1038,      study 001     M1,          fu,       0.012,     study 002     M1,          fumic,    1,         default     M1,          rb,       1,         study 002     M1,          fa,       NA,     M1,          fg,       NA,     M1,          ka,       NA,

title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
